Miṯqâl
[Tho]t 13, folio 5. \of a dînâr/ 3 1/2+1/3+1/12
[In the na]me of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful.
[So and So, son of al-Mu]waffaq has paid by his hands for different persons on account of that which was due from him for the land-tax (ḫarâǧ) of [the Capital]
thre[e dîn]ârs and a half and a third and a twelfth miṯqâl to the treasurer (qusṭâl) Menas (Mînâ), in the presence of Ḫulaiq, [son of So and So,]
and of al-Ḥusain b. Aḥmad, the two administrators of al-Walîd b. Yaḥyâ and Aḥmad b. Ḫâlid - may God exalt them - (set) ove[r the impost]
of the two districts (kûra) of al-Ušmûnain, Lower-Anṣinâ and Qûṣ for the impost of the year [23]3.
Thereof (has been paid) for himself 1 1/24+1/48
and for ʿAbd aṣ-Ṣamad b. al-Faiḍ 2 1/2+1/3+1/48
who (is called) ʿAbd al-Ḫâliq.
Saʿîd b. al-Qâsim is wi[tness] to the acknowledgment by the treasurer (qusṭâl) Mînâ b. Ibrâhîm, respecting that which (is contained) in [this quittance].
Chael b. Yoḥannes, the secretary, [is witne]ss to that which (is contained) in this quittance on 13th of Thot of the ye[ar 223].
Ǧuraiǧ b. Morqos [is witne]ss to the acknowledgment by the qusṭâl Minâ, respecting the payment of these three [dînârs]
[and a half and a third and a twelfth (of a dînâr)].
